Draft Rating:

F

John Nash ranks in the 8th percentile for drafting among executives in our database. Nash's draft picks average out to be worth the equivalent of 14 spots lower than they were picked due to their terrible drafting.
Some of their biggest wins:
  • Drafted Ha Seung-Jin with 46th pick but was worth 25th pick.
  • Drafted Evan Eschmeyer with 34th pick but was worth 31th pick.
  • Drafted Sergei Monia with 23th pick but was worth 21th pick.
Some of their biggest busts:
  • Drafted Juwan Howard with 5th pick but was worth 45th pick.
  • Drafted Calbert Cheaney with 6th pick but was worth 43th pick.
  • Drafted Sebastian Telfair with 13th pick but was worth 46th pick.

Trade Rating:

A-

John Nash ranks in the 82th percentile for trading among executives in our database.
Their biggest win:
  • Added Pervis Ellison to WSB.
  • Lost Jeff Malone to UTA.
  • Lost Mike Iuzzolino to SAC.
Their biggest L:
  • Added Linas Kleiza, Martell Webster, Joel Freeland to POR.
  • Lost Deron Williams to UTA.

Signing Rating:

B

John Nash ranks in the 67th percentile for free agency signings among executives in our database.
Their best signings:
  • Signed Chris Whitney in 1996.
  • Signed Scott Brooks in 1988.
  • Signed Eddie Gill in 2004.
Their worst signings:
  • Signed Joel Przybilla in 2004.
  • Signed Albert King in 1987.
  • Signed Bob Thornton in 1987.
